title: Sleeping man saved from Ashburton house blaze dashes back for TV
text:
Sleeping man saved from Ashburton house blaze dashes back for TV JACK FLETCHER AND MADDISON NORTHCOTT Last updated 11:26, February 2 2017 
Sonya Dunlea said she could see the flames "going nuts" behind the closed kitchen door. 
Fleeing after being woken up to find his house on fire, an Ashburton man ran back into the blaze to rescue his television. 
Sonya Dunleaâ€‹ was driving home from work when she saw smoke billowing out of the kitchen windows of an Allens Rd property on Wednesday. 
She and her colleague pulled over and called emergency services when she saw the front door was open. HOOPS ON AIR/FACEBOOK 
Four fire crews battled the house fire on Allens Rd for about an hour. 
The kindergarten teacher said she could see the flames "going nuts" behind the closed kitchen door. 
READ MORE: 
Unsure if anyone was inside, the pair yelled into the house and backed away from the entrance. 
"A man had been asleep in a room at the back of the house. 
"He came running out, but then he went back in to rescue his TV." 
With the prized television in hand, he ran back outside fast and was not injured, she said. 
"The house is burnt completely black, it's totally ruined." 
The man had lived at the property with his uncle. 
Dunlea said she heard two very distressed dogs barking from the unit adjoining the one on fire. 
Another person kicked the door down to let the dogs out, but the fire did not spread into the second home. 
Fire crews were expected to return on Thursday morning to investigate what sparked the blaze. 
Fire Service southern communications shift manager Brent Dunn said crews were called to the fire about 4.45pm on Wednesday. 
"It is a two-unit house and the right-hand unit was well ablaze when crews arrived," Dunn said. 
"When the fire is already ablaze before we get there, that's not good news as far as damage goes." 
Crews had extinguished the blaze by 5.45pm, but remained on site a while longer to dampen down hotspots, he said. - Stuff
